Model Object Module

A PROTEUS object.

class proteus.model.object.Object(project: Project, object_file_path: str, is_document_proxy_archetype=False)

A PROTEUS object is an XML file inside of a PROTEUS project ‘objects’ directory.

A PROTEUS object can only be created by cloning another existing object, usually an archetype object.

An already created object can be loaded by providing the path to its XML file.

clone_object(parent: Union[Object, Project])

Function that clones an object in a new parent. This function doesn’t save the object in the system but add it to the parent children so it will be saved when we save the project.

Parameters:

parent (Union[Object,Project].) – Parent of the new object.

generate_xml() → Element

It generates an XML element for the object.

Returns:

XML element for the object.

Return type:

ET.Element

generate_xml_to_XSLT() → Element

It generates an XML element for the document. It’s a must to create an special ET.Element for XSLT because it’s not possible to use document() function from the XSLT file using the path of the object file due to the XSLT processor.

Returns:

XML element for the object.

Return type:

ET.Element

static load(project: Project, id: ProteusID, directory=None) → Object

Static factory method for loading a PROTEUS object given a project and a short UUID.

Parameters:

  • project (Project) – Project object where the object is located.

  • id (ProteusID) – UUID of the project.

Returns:

Object object.

load_children(root: Element, is_document_proxy_archetype=False) → None

It loads a PROTEUS object’s children from an XML root element.

Parameters:

root (ET.Element) – XML root element.

class proteus.model.object.Project(path)
